Review: Ray's is Ray's, hasn't changed too much, yet still seems to update with the times. Good quality bar food and great beer selection.

This busy busy place is loud and bustling with folks! I wasn't comfortable because barely a mask was on and we were a foot away from strangers in the midst of COVID so I kept my mask on most of the time, but we enjoyed our food.Nothing much is low cal or a healthy option but what BBQ place is going to be!The ribs were fall off the bone tender, the onion rings were big and crispy, the fries were french (LOL) , the shredded pork was piled high with 2 sauces and the meatball parmesan was saucy and cheesy!Overall, a great smoky smelling spot for KSU families!

I've been coming to Ray's place since college. It's always a good time and I always know what to expect.  It's a Kent classic! There's a good mix of college kids and older adults. They ID at the door of course. There's a bunch of tables and booths inside - they easily accommodate bigger groups! There's also a bar inside as well. The bathrooms are also typically clean and well stocked, which is better than a lot of other bars in the area! The biggest thing they're known here for are Long Jsland Iced Teas - it's like their classic. They're $4.50 a glass. I'm a big beer drinker and they have a pretty extensive draft list, with a ton of local breweries, which is really great. If it's your birthday, they they have a fun wheel that you can spin for a free shot :) it's super fun. As for the food, it's pretty good! It's a lot of bar food fare, like sandwiches, burgers. onion rings, fries, etc. I'm never disappointed here, got onion rings the other night and it was pretty solid! My friend had a Reuben and really enjoyed it as well. As for parking, there's street parking available as well as public free lots nearby. I would highly recommend coming to ray's place to meet some friends, I always have a good time!!

Been going here since I was a kid. All of the specials are immaculate works of art. The chili is legendary and the same for decades and decades. The meatloaf is amazing. Burgers destroy the competition elsewhere. Belgian style fries are as good today as they were over forty years ago.Skip the hype elsewhere in town and give these people your money.

I've been eating (and drinking) at Ray's for decades now, and I can't believe it's taken me this long to leave a review. The food here is absolutely excellent. Of course, you're getting bar food (e.g. sandwiches, wings, fried food, etc.), but the quality is better than any around. We've even had our shop's Christmas party here upstairs (pre-pandemic), and they did a bang up job with a large group.This is a Kent staple and a must visit.Pro Tip: Order something that comes off of the smoker (e.g. wings, pastrami, bbq). Yes, they have one and smoke daily. You won't regret it!

The best burger ever! I was kind of bummed out because Sunday they wouldn't take any carry out orders. They said it was too busy for pick up orders which seemed strange to me, to turn down business because I didn't want to dine in?? Most places will take the order and caution that it's going to be an hour or so before it's busy. But anywho by the next day I had forgiven them and placed a take out order for the mo fo burger and fries. I'm so glad I did because it was GREAT!

We went for dinner and it was worth the wait time! By the time that we were seated, we knew what we wanted and ordered right away. My son ordered the ribs with fries, my daughter ordered the pulled pork sandwich with fries, my husband and I both ordered the blue cheese burger with fries. All of the food was delicious with great flavors! For dessert we ordered the key lime pie and my son and daughter shared it and said that it was good. I'd definitely recommend this place for lunch or dinner!

There are a lot of things I like about this place. I like how there is an upstairs and downstairs! It has a rustic aesthetic and I love the drinks. A bit on the pricier side, along with the food. I ordered the stir fry with shrimp which came to about $15. It was super good! And I had leftovers the next day. There were a couple other things I want to try. My only complaint is I wish there were more vegan or seafood options. This place is one of my favorites to go to in Kent. I like going upstairs with a friend!

I have been going to Rays Place since the 90's when I was a college student. I have watched it evolve from a simple town bar with good food to a fantastic all around restaurant. They have a great selection of alcohol and the menu is a perfect mix of bar type food and great meals. I have to admit my favorite has always been the max the knife sandwich and you can't say no to their fresh cut French fries. Also, it's pretty famous. If you ever find yourself in Kent, Ohio, you must stop in to say hello and have a few pints. Don't forget to pick up a t-shirt, you'd be amazed how wide you can travel the world and have people ask you about it!
Fast, friendly, and efficient.  Love all their beer and food. Mofo with poutine fries,  OUTSTANDING!!

I don't know why I haven't gone to Ray's sooner! Love the food and the amazing selection of beers and other drinks. Staff is always friendly! They also offer DORA drinks which is super nice too for when you are waiting to be sat.
Great beer selection, good food, but most importantly, best bathrooms in downtown Kent
Good food and good atmosphere!  Good size portions,  clean tables and booths .. love to visit again

I've only been to rays for the drinks which are absolutely amazing! Definitely suggest the Long Island iced tea! But the food was absolutely awful! I got the atomic burger which was super bland. Also the fries were super overdone and I ended the night feeling sick for hours! Definitely will stick to just drinks!

Just a regular ol' bar. Sports on the TV and decent music playing. VERY friendly bartenders. Menu is normal bar food with a twist, they have things like hummus, stir fry, and dumplings. My favorite thing on the menu is the smoked wings. I get them hot every time (and you HAVE to get them smoked) They're a Ray's Place favorite and for sure a go-to of mine. They taste absolutely spectacular and the meat just falls right off the bone Everything else on the menu is average, not much more to say.

As a bar, it's 5 stars. Ray's is quintessential Kent. Great classic atmosphere, always good service, open late. If you've never been to Kent, it's a must stop for a drink.I'm at about 3 stars for the food. I've eaten here a lot, because it's where everyone always wants to go, but it's incredibly hit or miss for me. I'm usually more excited to drink here than eat. The good: The smoked pastrami sandwiches are a must try, loads of smoky flavor. The mussels appetizer is top notch, way better than you'd expect from pub food. If you get the pulled pork sandwich, they give you a heaping pile of meat. I got a gourmet burger once and thought it was really tasty. The fried pickles and the sauce that come with them are great. I've also always enjoyed the garlic finger wrap. The bad: I hate wasting food, but I don't think I even finished the meatloaf. It's a savory (gravy) rather than sweet (ketchup/ bbq) meatloaf, and tasted like something out of a TV dinner. Maybe it was just that day, and was made a few days before and just re-heated, but not good that particular time. My wife ordered a burger yesterday. They never asked how she wanted it cooked, and it came out with hockey puck consistency, and taste. People love the wings, but I've had bad luck. They were fatty and rubbery when I tried them. The weird: The fries. Sandwiches don't come with fries, you have to order them separately, which is fine. But a single order is $4.75, and it comes in a basket that serves like 4 people. That's great if you want to share, but if you're just a person that wants some side fries, it's expensive and excessive. If you get a $6 basket, I'd imagine it feeds 10-12 people, I'm joking, sort of. The jerk fries are great and have a good kick. The suns stix (sweet potato) are good when cooked normally, but I've had them either totally burnt or underdone enough times to avoid them.
Classic bar in Kent. Great beer selection. The food is ok. Worth a visit in Kent as a classic place.
We planned a very casual class reunion here.  Charlie, the manager, was extremely responsive and helpful. Everyone had a great time, and we loved "coming home"again!
A staple for Kent State Students! Amazing burgers, apps, and drinks for a good price. 1000% recommend.
My wife and I always go here when in town. We live n Louisiana. Best burgers around in Kent.
Had a Rueben on the recommendation of a friend and was very impressed.   Nice local establishment with quality food.
I'm not a five star reviewer, but this place gets a 4.5 from me. Great food. Exceptional service. Would highly recommend this place to anyone dropping their kids off at KSU!

We absolutely love Ray's. Probably the best burger in town( with the works)  we sometimes change it up but usually we just get their burger and onion rings and their  employees are amazing and great with friendly service....  love it - we enjoy our time there.

The best Long Island you'll ever get is here! Their  food is great as well.  Always will go for a burger or the quesadillas! Highly recommend if you're wanting to drink and eat. The atmosphere and staff are always great and friendly

Came here on a Sunday evening to catch the game and grab dinner. Fairly sparse crowd as you'd expect for a Sunday night, but plenty of tvs which made it easy to watch. Great variety of beers available at reasonable prices. Their flight deal (4 5oz beers costs however much the most expensive of the 4 as a pint is) is one of the best values I can remember. Nachos were tasty, nice serving size for the price, but nothing to write home about. The stir fry was much better than you would expect from a sports bar! All the veggies were well roasted, the chicken wasn't too dry and the Szechuan sauce went nicely with all of it. Overall, chill place to catch a game with a wider array of food options than the appearance would lead you to believe.

An icon of the Kent scene. Above average bar fare, decent drinks. I wouldn't make a special trip there just for the food, but as I stated earlier it is an icon of the Kent scene and must be experienced.... Oh, the staff is fantastic

Ray's a great go to in the college scene that is downtown Kent. Having visited prior to the pandemic, the experience was just as I remembered from 20 years earlier - great food, great selection of beers, loud lively 'ambience' and just the vibe you'd expect a long standing 'go-to' divey like place to have. The sandwich, wings, and soup were all good to great. The service was pretty good too and the seating options pretty good, depending on your preferences. Good burgers or really good pastrami on rye would be my recommendations for the first timers.

Entree: Chicken Parm Sandwich w/friesMy first couple of bites were really good. It was juicy and had a lot of sauce and cheese which I love!! However the next bites after that were a little dry. If the chicken wasn't overcooked it would be delish. It think it just went a little too long. The fries were undercooked and a little cold. Overall: It was ok Return Visit: I am willing to give it another try. My wife and I stopped in for a beer and a quick bite. Our family's been telling us about this place for years. It lived up to the hype. Loved the vibe, beer selection, and the food was amazing. Will definitely be back!

I love this place! Have been coming to this bar for years .My son bartended there during his college years! The food was always so good ! Well that has changed. We ate there last night and I didn't recognize anything we ordered except the onion rings. I ordered a Rueben Sandwich. The corn beef was so tuff and the  sauerkraut was tasteless. The pumpernickel bun it came on was awful. Rueben's are supposed to be on grilled rye or marble rye . The bun wasn't even grilled. Another person ordered a club sandwich and the bacon wasn't even cooked completely. The fried pickles came out of a bag I'm sure! You couldn't even tell it was a pickle. My husband has never not finished a hamburger but he got the stuffed burger and couldn't finish it. The nachos we're disgusting . Can't complain about the service everyone was so nice. They did exchange my sandwich for a cheeseburger that was good! Don't know that we will be going back! It's so disappointing. So many good memories at Rays Place! Fix the menu or fix the chef !

"Yeah! That's my mo-fo!" -- Jerry Maguire (1996)I travel quite a bit for work and rely on Yelp to help me find the right places to eat (Thanks fellow Yelpers). My coworker was no help, so I happened upon Rays. I ready so much about the Jerk fries and the MoFo Burger, we just had to come.This is definitely a "hang-out" type of joint. The place was busy, but not too busy. A more relaxed atmosphere, but this isn't a place to come when you are in a hurry. My coworker and I grabbed a seat and ordered a couple of things to start and a couple of drinks. He was happy with the beer selection, so we were all set. Jerk fries are where's its at! This is a MUST. So flavorful, you just can't stop eating them. We also ordered the fried mac n cheese. They were good, but paled in comparison to the fries. I mean, really everything did. I also ordered the MoFo Burger (as instructed by fellow Yelpers) and I wasn't disappointed, but it was a lot. It's a double stack, but more-so than I am used to where I am from. Usually, they are super thin patties. So when I was asked how I wanted it cooked, I knew it was going to be big.The burger came out medium (as instructed) and it was juicy and delicious. Piled high with toppings (mushrooms, ftw) and tough to eat (who has a mouth that big?). I had to squash it down to be able to eat it - and it was pretty messy. I was too full to try the peanut butter pie (fail), but man it looked amazing. I would come back again, for sure.But damn those fries...
Ray's IS the place!beer selection? amazing!food? always delicious!smoked food?must have!I've been going to Rays since 1981and I've loved it every time.try it, you'll like it

I was given an extremely hard time by the floor manager of this place. She told me my ID was fake simply because it was an out of state ID. How embarrassing. Next time anyone from the northeast comes here, I hop you invite the entire national guard with you. Otherwise, please do not expect to be able to come into this establishment.

A little bit loud, BUT overall wonderful place! Absolutely delicious, homemade everything!! It's a bar, so makes sense. I got the Mustard Seed 2.0 and a side of French Onion Soup, both we're super filling and absolutely delicious. Classic place to go in Kent and wonderful selection of beers on draft, too! Enjoyed an Oktoberfest. Mussels and Pickle fries as an appetizer, yummy! Super delish seasoning on the food, and the French onion soup was absolutely perfect.Definitely a cute, traditional place to visit while in Kent!
Our favorite place for dinner and a beer in Kent! The on-tap list goes on and on. Poutine fries (with house smoked pulled pork), chili, and the veggie pitas are some of our favorites.

This is my favorite place to go in NE Ohio, anytime and all the time.  The beer selection is absolutely crazy - I cannot tell you how many they have on tap and bottled - but pretty much any beer you'd like to sample, well they have it, especially NE Ohio beers.  Of course they serve traditionals like Guinness and Bass, one of the only places I know of to get Bass on draft.The food is wonder for a pub venue.  The wings are the best in NE Ohio by far, and among the best I have ever had, big, meaty and deliciously prepared with a choice of many sauces.  The burgers are awesome, and the double burger with cheddar and bacon is a culinary killer.  The chicken quesadilla delicious and quite filling, as are the hot nachos.  We go every week and have - never - had a bad meal at Ray's.  French onion soup, BBQ, salads... everything is prepared fresh and carefully.Ray's atmosphere is also wonderful.  The waitstaff is amazingly attentive considering just how busy it is here... and it is always busy on any day of the week (I've been on every day...).  The Pub is also for everyone - old, young babies, college kids, retired, even people ordering a bottle of wine... in an Irish Pub.  Plus, it is located in downtown Kent.I just love Ray's... it's my go-to for food and beer, and I highly recommend it.
Service was 5 stars, Everyone walking by checked on us! Food was good, but we felt some of it was a little bland. However the menu is extensive, we'll be back to try out other things!

Loving this place. Lunch. Very friendly staff, great food, and great place! Love the view and the walk to get here. Right downtown, but you can wander around and bump into things, to work up an appetite. Daily specials, beer and food. The menu is killer.  Just pretty darn happy right now, all due to this place.  Thank you Ray's!
Amazing food and drinks.  Boddingtons on draft. Fantastic menu. Great atmosphere.

Whenever we visit Kent Ohio we always look forward to eating at Rays...we are never disappointed!all the food is great so its hard to pick but the burger is unreal! Fresh cut homemade fries and of course, the largest selection of cold brews in the area. Highly recommend to all!

This place was highly recommended by a few coworkers. Everyone said to try the wings. I ordered the smoked wings with the Cilantro-Lime-garlic sauce on the side. I was disappointed as the wings were very dry, inside and out, and the outside was crunchy. These almost appeared & tasted like they were Fried, not smoked. I've eaten plenty of wings, as they are my top 5 fav foods, and these just didn't live up to the hype. With enough sauce I did eat them because they were edible and I don't like to waste. My two other friends enjoyed their food! Would've given a 4 star review but I gave a 3 star because of the service. Our waitress came to our table once to give us waters and then to drop off our food. Never saw her again after that. After sitting for awhile and not seeing her, we finally asked the hostess for the check. Since my friends enjoyed their food, I would give Ray's Place another chance because I do understand every place has an off day.

I have NEVER experienced something like this before. My boyfriend and I were in town for my graduation. We walked over to eat dinner from a quick beer at Water Street Bar at 5pm. We had a plastic Kent State souvenir cup (empty) and we sat at the bar. An older bartender yelled at us for having the cup saying they were a direct competitor. We didn't have anywhere to put the cup so he wouldn't serve us. He told us we were advertising another bar as he continued to yell. He made a scene in front of customers. I think he lost more customers yelling at us and making a scene about it rather than the "cup advertising". I have never been to Kent State (I'm a distance learner) so I'm not familiar with Kent State. DO NOT support an establishment that treats their customers like this. I do not recommend this place. We never made it to the food because he refused to serve us with the cup. I would give this place negative 20 stars if I could.

This place is one of those restaurants/bars you always come to if you're in Kent. That being said, it's almost always busy here and it gives for room for your order to be wrong/longer wait times. I highly recommend the wings, either smoked and traditional. Our server recommended the cilantro lime garlic sauce and it didn't disappoint!! I usually come here while on a bar crawl but I would come back for the food also

A Kent landmark. Generations of students and townies have eaten here side-by-side.Excellent burgers that are on the large side. Their Mo-Fo Burger has been lauded by celebrity chef Michael Simon as the best burger he's ever had but it is beyond my capabilities.The dining room is not especially comfortable; wooden stools, straight-backed chairs, or hard wooden booths are the seating options. The decor is average dive bar and the music is meh. Lotsa tvs tuned in to sports. A second bar is located upstairs and is a popular spot for private parties. Catering is available there.Servers are attentive without hovering.

Ray's is open again and serving the best burgers in Kent. I challenge you to find better! The meat is slightly charred, has great grilled flavor. Fries and o-rings are awesome, and the chili is top notch. Get there on a Friday when they have clam chowder, it's outstanding. Keep up the good work!
Great food. Great service. Great atmosphere. My husband and I came here for lunch and we will not leave disappointed. If in Kent, must stop for a bite.

Looking for a beer and a burger? Look no further. This place has a great selection on tap. Be sure to try their beer flight to get a good buzz going.Food is flavorful; I'm especially taken with the MoFo burger and the wings. The wings, in particular, were not over-fried nor dry and stringy - rather, they were perfectly juicy, tender, and hot.Overall, the dining/drinking experience was a good one. Service was snappy. Get a bar seat to observe the bartenders punch in sales on an old-time cash register. It's all good fun.
Try a signature Long Island and their burgers. Cheap prices, great bar, good food and drinks!

Last Saturday was my fist and last visit. My daughter left her purse there and called the next morning to ask about it. She was told there was no purse. She drove up and asked if she could look upstairs where she had been seated, and was told no, because there were customers. The manager took her name and said he would call her if they located it. She got no phone call. She cancelled her credit cards. The next day after work, her husband went up there and was able to walk upstairs where the purse was exactly where she left it. Terrible way to treat customers. He obviously never looked for it. The only bright spot of the visit was the waiter. He was awesome.
Good burgers and good beer on a Friday night. Wait staff are friendly and prompt. Always enjoy going to Ray's Place.

This one is more for nostalgia than anything. Ray's is and always will be my favorite place in Kent. Nothing fancy and the downstairs lighting will always be a bit too bright, but you gotta love Ray's Place.The staff is always professional and attentive. They aren't always warm and fuzzy, but they are real - and that to me is better than being around someone trying to fake it through the night!The food at Ray's is very good for bar food and the tap lines are always clean, so hangovers aren't as bad...which is important!!I definitely recommend Ray's Place when you visit Kent.  It's an institution.

This place was recommended by a colleague and it was ok. Ray's has a ton of taps and a variety of bottles and cans, so they have options for any beer lover. The staff was attentive and friendly. I had fried pickles which were great. I tried the sandwich special which was mediocre at best. Their menu has plenty to choose from, but I typically go for specials... well because they are usually special. No need to call it out, but it makes you wonder about the rest of the menu. At any rate, the staff and beer selection make this place worth while.

Ray's was recommended by a student at Kent State while we were on a college visit. Since we needed lunch and ended up at the fashion building on the downtown edge of the campus anyway we walked to the railroad tracks. it was hard to find. signage is very subtle, the awning was clear but hard to see from the sidewalk. just look for a Irish pub kind of place.the ground level was packed at 4 pm on a Friday. fun kind of Irish pub place, servers racing around. the hostess suggested we go upstairs since it was crowded and we had 5 people. very good suggestion as we were the first to be seated. I got the 4-flight of beers, including an imperial Stout, a gose, and a house IPA. I love the flights.we started with fried pickles, since some of the kids had not had them. excellent. we all had burgers. the student recommended the"mofo" Burger, but it looked too big. I ended up with the stuffed gourmet, which was about 6 inches tall and excellent. others did the naked burger and dressed it. I had the jerk fries; they were good, but not real jerky, more like seasoned fries. they were good and greasy. we left very full and the upstairs dining room was packed by the time we left. popular place and with good reason.
Among the top wings I've had. Try them plain with the sauces on the side! Crazy selection of draft beers to top it off.

Ray's is hands down my favorite place in NE Ohio to get a Burger!  When you want good old Bar Food, this is where you go. While the Burgers are the highlight for me, the wings and fries are also huge hits! Especially the Jerk Fries!  The also have a fairly extensive list of Craft Beers on tap and in bottle. Each time I go I find something new.  The first time I was here I found my favorite burger, the MoFo! I got to wash it down with a WTF beer! I love telling that story. Ray's is the only place I know where you can get a MoFo and WTF!It can get crowded in here at peak times but they do have downstairs and upstairs seating. If one looks busy, check the other. It is a perfect place for after work gatherings or parties. They have always accommodated our large work groups if we call a few days ahead.  The staff has been great and always knowledgeable of the menu including drinks.  Since it is located in downtown Kent, parking can be tricky at times but if you luck out, you can find free street parking. Just don't try to park across the street in the Puffer Belly lot. They watch it like hawks!
I was in the  mood food Guinness draft and mussels and this place had it.  Good attentive service and reasonable prices.

So.....we came here and got seated, party of 5, after about 20 minutes. Once seated we got our drinks in about 10 minutes later. Ordered about 10 minutes after that. That was the last time I saw an employee of Ray's at our table for the next 40 minutes. We watched as other tables, that were seated after us, got their food. I finally got our waiter's attention and asked about our food. I was assured it was on its way out in 5 or 10 minutes. 25 minutes later I got up, found our waiter, and asked him why we still had no food. That's an hour and a half after being seated if you're keeping score. While I was talking to the waiter, the manager came up and asked what the problem was. I told him and he explained that he instructed his staff to tell everyone that the food would take an hour after ordered. Had we been told that, we would have never sat. It was now 9pm. That was the extent of our conversation. The food arrived shortly thereafter. This is where my negative review falls off the rails. It was amazing. Every single item. Amazing. It was legitimately one of my favorite meals. As we were finishing up, the waiter came and apologized and said the manager was comping the entire meal because of the delay. I went back to the manager and told him I didn't want a free meal. I told him the problems we were having were not related to the food. I WANTED to pay for the meal because it was that good. He refused and simply asked that we give them another try when it wasn't so busy (because of KSU move in day presumably) and I agreed to do that. I will update this review once we eat there again. I tipped the waiter 20 bucks and we left. I'm giving three stars because the wait really was atrocious, but the food. Man. So good. We'll be back soon.  I have high hopesUpdate 12-8-18:True to my word we came back. Service was spot on and the food was equally as good as before. I got the wings and they weren't my style, but they were good. I like my wings a little thinner and dryer and these things were monsters. Like I said, good just not for me. The rest of the food was great. Family of 5 for $60. We'll be back. The first time looks like a fluke.

Ray's Place is one of those legendary-to-locals restaurant/bars that many college towns have - lots of sports and local memorabilia on the walls, scuffed floorboards, sassy wait staff and big plates of food washed down with beer. Ray's does it better than most. We walked in on a Saturday evening (the night of the NBA finals!) and made our way around the big bar/dining room to a table. While it was self-seating for us, I doubt it's like that when it's super-busy. Lots of families chowing down on wings and other bar food. Our server was nice, attentive and a whirlwind as the crowd got bigger.The menu is large and varied, with plenty of seafood on the menu, and lots of Greek/Mediterranean influences in the dishes (read Feta and goat cheese, olives, etc.). They must be known for their Fo-Mo burger, which is a double cheeseburger with bacon, mushrooms and all the fixins. Looked good, but we ended up with a Pittsburgh throwback "Steak-n-Fry" salad for the spouse and a French onion soup (decent) and a half-smoked chicken for me. The chicken specifically tasted like it had been in the smoker all day - nicely done.Honestly? Traditional non-fancy bar food should be this good always. Stop up at Ray's to try it for yourself.
What a neat little place. They have a great menu with lots of selections. Pleasant staff. The food was delicious. Definitely will visit again.

Thought this place seemed cool and I heard good things but went in to get food just to get greeted by a very unprofessional manager who thought a member of the party had a fake passport despite everyone in the group being well over 21. Wouldn't waste my business here
NA

Not a bad joint to visit in Kent.  Menu is huge. The seating I feel can be arranged a little different for more of a welcoming feeling.  You walk in and BAM!  It feels like you are walking into a mosh pit lol. Place would benefit with a hostess and seating away from the front door. If I'm in the area I'll definitely give it another shot.

Great food, beer selection, full bar and great service! Whenever we are in town this is a must stop and never disappoints. All food is good and there is something everyone will enjoy   We had mussels for lunch. Loved them, but it is hard to chose because there are so many great things on the men
When I think bacon cheeseburger and a cold one, Ray's is the only place!! Try the French fries too, you won't be disappointed.

Great vibes. Great service. Nice location in downtown Kent. The place was packed which is nice. It's always fun to feel like you chose a happening spot, and this did the trick. It had one of my all time favorite beers on tap, the Willoughby Peanut Butter Coffee Porter. While I love the PBCP, I might be outgrowing it as it was crazy sweet. Anyway, they had tons of other beers on tap. About 20-30 in fact. They also have a huge selection of canned/bottled beers that make for a huge selection. Good prices as well. As for the food, I just had a dozen smoked wings. They were good (but it's kind of hard to mess up wings). I'm curious to try more food off the menu. If end up living here, I'm sure to be a regular at Ray's place.
The hot pastrami sandwich was amazing. I've never had pastrami with such a great smoky flavor.

I really like the atmosphere. The service and food were great.  Got the MoFo burger which was very good although messy!  Looks as though they are renovating the downstairs and only upstairs was open.  Great place for a late afternoon burger and a couple of beers.
When in townI always stop in to See Charlie Ray &Go Crazy. When in Kent visiting state U

Ray's place is a must stop if you're in the Kent OH area. They food is always on point and their variety is what sets them apart from the other bars in the area. They are known for their wide variety of draft beer, so if you're a beer lover, you're in luck! They are also known for their long island ice teas, so be sure to pick one up as well. The staff is always friendly and the place is always clean. Definitely one of my top 5 favorite bars

Avoid this place until they get their kitchen in order. On a normal, not that busy night the kitchen took almost two hours to send our two burgers, dozen wings and basket of fries. Ridiculous. The burger came raw. This place needs to get their act together.

I came here for a lunch meeting. I ordered the hamburger well done and it tasted delicious. I had the jerk fries and they tasted great! A recommendation for sure. It was a little busy and crowded but we got our food quickly. Parking was available but you have to pay. We parked about a block away where it was free. I really want to stop here for a beer next time Im in town.
NA

Ray's has some great food including the best burgers in Kent and what I would argue is the best sandwich I've yet had in Kent - the CUBAN.  I tried the Cuban once on a whim and now I am obsessed. The Cuban consists of smoked pulled pork and ham (double pork!) sandwiched in between two flatbreads with melty cheese (I usually ask for Pepperjack but it comes with Swiss) and crispy wonderful dill pickle slices. It is served with a side of "Annato Mayo" which is an unusual sauce that I find intellectually confusing but quite palatable and complimentary to the sandwich in practice. This sandwich is BIG so I'm usually left with at least a second half that gets happily devoured for lunch later in the week. Amazing with their jerk fries which are fantastically spiced! (And a "single" order of fries, as opposed to the "basket", comes in a smaller basket and is plenty for two to split!) It's often quite busy, and sometimes it's difficult to find a table if the upstairs is closed. You can eat at the bar but waiting around is well worth it as well!  They run a tight ship here and I've found service is consistently good even when they're slammed.In terms of it also being a bar, they have a wonderful selection of drafts and ok cocktails. Long Island Ice teas seem to be perpetually on sale and they are ok too. For some reason, this is the bar everyone decides they want to be at around 1:30am. I've never understood waiting at the door to get into a bar fifteen minutes before last call but I guess it's a thing.  Ray's gets extra kudos for what I've heard second-hand about their great treatment of employees. It seems like they go all out for their people with events like their employee Christmas party and summer camp-out.

Not sure what happened tonight?  Kitchen was REALLY REALLY slow. Cjrcked in on yelp nearly 50 minutes ago. One  or two drinks later and we are still waiting on food.   We are hungry!!!  Big change ..... very disappointed, no more flat iron steak with Blue chhese

Tonight I went to dinner at Ray's Place in Kent Ohio and it was an underwhelming experience.*Drinks*    Crown Apple & Diet Coke*Food*    Bacon Cheeseburger add Mushrooms    Poutine FriesRay's Place was nice and busy as normal. Finding a seat was difficult but once I had one I was engaged within 5 minutes and ordered my drink. I sat at the bar as it was only place open and my server/bartender was kind enough to ask if i wanted a single or double. Drink was served quickly and was very well made.Food was served quickly enough as well. Sadly this is where i had a lack luster experience. The Burger was good. Nothing amazing, no stand out flavor but a burger cooked properly. The Poutine option I chose was where the entire experience was really hurt. Their Poutine is serves with fries, pulled brisket?, gravy, mozzarella balls. Now the Mozzarella was the most flavorful thing in the whole thing... Fries tasted unseasoned, and the meat was...... not great more like day old stew beef? That was not the worst part.. All oft hat could have been saved if well the gravy wasn't just terrible. congealed flavorless. I added pepper twice and still did not get any actual flavor... Almost like someone just thickened a sauce leftover? Sadly this kinda ruined my mean as it was largest part of it.All of that for 25$ I would say Probably overpriced. If the Poutine wasnt terrible I would say pricey but worth it. Sadly its left as just overpriced.

First saw Ray's Place on TV, so had to try it, and it gave me a reason to drive to Kent.  Comfortable old college bar, clean and nice, including the bathrooms.  Singles, a group of older folks, a family.....all having dinner at Ray's!  The burger with the soft round bun was delicious.....have it your way.  The crunchy battered onion rings were....can't eat just two, eat more!  I got dinner and tip under $10. Has a big picture window with a nice outdoor view.  Good choice.

Ray's is one of the oldest bars in Kent and holds a special place in the heart of nearly every local & student! If you are from the area, you know all about Ray's. But if you're not, it's a classic themed, two story bar and restaurant that serves typical American food and good beer (as well as a full bar). At night, the upstairs area turns into the typical bar scene. I've never actually hung out downstairs after hours... I think maybe the older crowd hangs out down there?If it's your birthday you get a free shot by spinning a giant wheel and taking the one it lands on. But these shots are purposely made the be really gross and unusual

These angels lost power tonight (along with the rest of the bars on Franklin and some on Water). I placed my food order about 10-15 mins before power went out and they got me my order. I was looking forward to Ray's wings all day. Not only that, but they got everything correct in the dark. Most places can't deliver you a medium-rare burger with power on, let alone in the dark! Thanks so much to the kitchen staff and the bar tenders for being flexible and getting us our food order!!! Long live Ray's!!

Stopped by after visiting Kent State.  This restaurant was pretty busy for 2 pm, but there were tables still available.  We had a pulled pork sandwich, Cuban sandwich, bacon cheeseburger and kids spaghetti.  None of the sandwiches came with a side, you had to order sides separate, so we ordered a basket of fries.  It was more than enough for 3 people.  The sandwiches were liked by us who had them--I had the Cuban and it was amazing!  Food came out quick and was hot.  The kids spaghetti was disappointing.  It was a plate of noodles with a small cup of sauce and one meatball.  No additional side (other kids meals came with fries or applesauce).    Still a good place to stop for a meal!
Old college hangout with really good food and service. Eclectic menu. ( I had chicken stir fry and my husband had a great hamburger). The place was crowded and it was clean and a lot of fun.

This restaurant is typically for Kent State alum reliving their glory days and it shows. The service was good, though it was probably due to it being 4:30 in the afternoon during the summer. Portions were big for a fairly inexpensive price per person, so it would probably be a  good place to go with large groups. I ordered a turkey burger and shared one plate of french fries and one plate of their signature sweet potato fries with one other person and we struggled finishing it. The turkey burger was good but nothing to write home about and the french fries were a little undercooked and flavorless. However, their sweet potato fries were phenomenal and if I ever came back I would get those and leave.
It's all about the sweet potato fries aka sun fries! 5/5 just for those, to be honest.
NA
NA
Good service, very attentive! We had wings md sandwiches which was all good and sports bar like! We went to watch a football game and they have plenty of TVs. Cute little college town bar.

This place is really great for a big group of people. They're always packed, the drinks are super cheap while also having a huge option of beers, plus this is the oldest bar in Kent. Overall I would give it 5 stars, but one waitress did put a bad taste in my mouth.She came to the table to ask what we wanted and after my order in the worst tone and attitude "are you gonna tab out, because you're not gonna do this over and over, so if you want more keep it open"I would recommend starting with "would you like to open a tab?" And if I said no then kindly inform me of the options.Also, weirdly smells like sewage in the back left corner of the bar. Once we moved we didn't smell it anymore.

Ray's Place as a restaurant is about three or four stars. There's a lot on the menu, varying in quality, but at least you have the option.Ray's as a bar is the best spot in Kent. The upstairs level is very college-y, with a pool table, full bar, and brightly lit. It's always packed. The main floor/downstairs is cozily lit. The music is never intrusively loud, nor is the sound. Rays is the type of bar you can have a conversation at. If it's not a more mature crowd, then it's a more chill crowd. The people looking to get rowdy usually stop in to spin the birthday wheel and leave or go upstairs. One thing I cannot praise Rays enough for is forcing their bartenders to be educated on how to properly make a drink. Their legendary Long Island's are always consistent in taste. I've never had a drink made so poorly it was undrinkable, which I can't say for other bars in the area. Ray's is an awesome way to kick off, end, or even spend the night at. You'll never run into a sobbing drunk girl or someone passed out in the bathroom. You'll have quality drinks and a relaxed night.

Really really good tavern/pub hangout here. Great atmosphere with many tv's screens and an open floor. Theres even an upstairs! The people here are very friendly and helping. My southwest salad was absolutely HUGE and very very tasty. I also like the location alot in downtown Kent. A must if you're in the area.

One of my favorite places on earth. We had the best times here in the late 90's. The ambiance can't be duplicated. Went yesterday and nothing has changed. Their fries are awesome! Smoked wings were great. I had the blue moon sandwich. It's way way better than Panini's. Please don't ever change or go out of business. I was so happy to be there yesterday.

On an episode of Best Thing I Ever Ate on the Food Network, Michael Symon named the MoFo at Ray's the best burger he'd ever had... and he owns hamburger restaurants.So while in that part of the world, I stopped in for a MoFo. I'd been to Ray's before, but only for the brews, many, many years ago. I must say, the MoFo is gigantic, so much so that I believe it has it's own gravitational pull as mine practically imploded on itself. Easily the messiest burger I've ever had, but it was very, very tasty! Just know that this is a burger in which you might have to repent after eating, as your very soul may need a good scrub.

Great place! Great drinks, food, and very welcoming environment. Only complaint i would have is the staff is a little rude. One bartender in specific was asking if we were going to tip while we were still enjoying drinks and i feel like that's something you don't ask someone. I had a tab open so i was just going to tip based on how many drinks i had ordered like i Always do.
Had a great experience.   Really good food and great service.    Nice draft selection.   Had the gourmet stuffed burger, jerk fries, cheeseburger and calamari at our table.  All were delicious.

It really had the feel of a Colorado Brewery, with the windows open to the street and the mellow tone.  Bar tender was uber friendly, attentive, and knowledgeable.  He made an amazing Black and Tan that was made with Rasputin instead of Guinness.  Fantastic!  Lots of good food options beyond the usual bar foods including mussels and some pickle fries.  Fun relaxing place.  Lots of beer choices.  Would like to try their club sandwich.

We have been there three times and the food has always been good. Very good French onion soup and very large salads.  Service was a little slow but they were very busy so we didn't get too worked up about it. Enjoyable atmosphere.  We will be returning.
NA

Ordered take out. The chicken was bad tasting, the beef was tough and a weird color. The guacamole was dark and not fresh. The chips were stale. I loved Tonys but Rays...no way. Wont be back and that is sad because i went to Tonys ll the time...very sad
We were in town for a couple days and tried this place based on yelp ratings and reviews. Fantastic!  Any time we are in town we will be back!

Staff was friendly, wings were amazing! I had the smoked wings with their hottest sauce and it wasn't absurdly hot. I tried to go back on a Friday night the same week and it was completely packed so I had to go somewhere else. I'll be back when it's not 'Parent's Weekend'.

As a current student at Kent State, I can honestly say that Rays has been a staple place for my friends and I to visit the past four years. Rays was actually the first place I ate at when visiting the university for the first time. When I come back as an alumni to recollect on the glory days, I will be sure to visit Rays. Almost any time someone visits me from out of town, I take them to Rays. It's a local staple, and I've found that if someone from out of town has heard of Kent, they most likely have heard of Rays. When I come to the restaurant during the day to eat, I usually get the veggie pita and fries. I'm a vegetarian, and this is one of my favorite places to get a veggie pita. When I come to Rays at night to go to the bar, it's is always busy! Every time I go to the bars in Kent, I end up at Rays at some point during the night. The Long Islands are what the bar is known for, and I usually like to go to the second floor if it's open since it's usually less crowded. Rays will for sure be one place that I will miss when I graduate.

Ate their twice this week, and have been many times in the past. Good food, solid beer selection, and great atmosphere. Had a burger on wed night (spicy something or other) and a Cuban sandwich tonight. Burger was good, Cuban was outstanding. Very rare that I can't get through a meal, but I actually took half the Cuban to go, since it was so big. Good smoky pork and salty ham on flat bread. Finished it as soon as I got home. 45 minute drive from home, but well worth the trip!

This place is a classic in Kent. Known and loved by many. I'm a particular fan of their well-priced burgers and sweet potato fries. The Cuban sandwich is also really good! Best places to sit are upstairs by windows, downstairs tucked in the booths in the room off to the back right or at either bar...upstairs bar is usually my preferred, though they usually have Boddington's on tap downstairs. Ray's serves a wide range of crowds from family at dinner to college students late at night. As the night goes on only expect fried food items from the kitchen.

Another Yelp Success Story!   We were visiting the Kent area as my daughter just got accepted at Kent State.    After a great day spent on campus we started looking for a good place to eat and end the day.   Rays Place popped up on Yelp, it was close by, so in we went. It was on a Friday afternoon, just about ready to hit the dinner rush hour so we were lucky as we only had a 10 min wait or so.   In the mean time the smell of the food cooking and watching everyone guzzle down the beers made everything look very promising.   Clearly when you walk into Rays, there is no doubt this place has been around for some time and it is well used.    Not the cleanest place, BUT, by far not a dump.    The wait staff is energetic, know their way around the menu and provide good tips on what beer to get.   We started off with a few appetizers which one could make a meal of just by this menu alone.   But, we were in good spirits, having a lot of fun and we stuffed ourselves silly and order some main meals as well and boy they did not disappoint us.  Thank you Rays Place for putting the cherry on the top of a great day!
Cool vibe to hangout anytime with friends and family  awesome service! I ordered long island tea and cherry bomb shots and so happy about it

My favorite place to grab a beer and a burger in Kent. I have lived here for 12 years and I would not recommend any other place!Very family friendly, relaxing environment. They have been around since the 30's and even have the old school cash registers.Many joyful memories are to be made at Rays!I used to drink with my professors after lab here, and I even convinced my Grandma to have her first beer here the day I graduated!They always have a huge list of beer on draft and always something I have not tried. Try a flight of 4 beers, you can't go wrong!The "Sun Stix" (sweet potato fries) are awesome and I routinely eat a family sized portion myself. Treat yourself to a burger, I have tried them all a dozen times and have a wonderful experience each time. And that's coming from a hard-to-please carnivore.Ray's is the place to be!

Ray's has been around for a while and is highly regarded in the town.  The service is excellent, they have a great beer selection and many menu choices.   I had the chili which was quite tasty.  The burger was very good.  My wife had the chicken parm sandwich which arrived looking like it had just escaped an NHL game.  When we commented that it was very dark rather than golden brown we were told "that's the way we cook it".  She switched to a BLT, which other than not served on toasted bread was good.  Even though there is no smoking in the restaurant, there is a window to the street which is open to the sidewalk where people went outside to smoke.  If we are in town again, we would probably come again.  The service, people, people, ambiance, location, price and selections are a high 4 but the lack of a toaster, over cooked (or old oil) chicken parm take Ray's to a three.

There is a group of us from work that have been coming to Ray's for Friday lunch for years.  So obviously I'm a regular, but I really think it is just OK.It is a landmark in Kent, been here forever.  You almost have to check it out at least once.For the most part it your typical bar food, with a little bit of an update.  Burgers, sandwiches, even some salads.  They used to have lunch specials, but they disappeared a while ago.  Generally, the more unhealthy (burgers, meatloaf sandwich, corned beef) the better it is; their healthier stuff isn't as good (though the taco salad is pretty good).  Everyone talks about their big baskets of fries, but I think the fries are just OK; non-crispy shoestring fries.It is kind of variable, some Fridays it is very busy, others are quiet.  There are days the kitchen and waitstaff is better than others.I'd probably even give it 2.5 stars if Yelp let me, but I'd struggle to give it 3.  I wish it was better than it really is.

Greeted as I entered and picked a, table in the middle of the restaurant.  Big menu with lots of choices.  Ordered a draft beer and I came quickly to the table.  Ordered a dinner salad and it was promptly served, but it had a lot of brown lettuce in it, mixed with the spinach and other leafy veggies.  The blue cheese dressing was out of a bottle, but was good.  Waitress suggested the Ruben...
OMG one of the best burgers ever..oh yeah, the handcut fries ain't so bad either! The service was great and I would certainly recommend this place.
A college bar - not really our scene.  Food just okay. Service just okay. Won't go back.

Ray's is a local staple - let's be real, everyone loves Ray's. Any time alumni visit or family comes in from out of town, Ray's is where they want to go. It's a really cool place, with exposed brick, walls of windows, and two floors - which means two different bars, with different beers on tap depending on where you are. I haven't had anything bad here, but my favorite is definitely the Cuban Sandwich - instead of on a bun, they serve the sandwich on flat bread (which means its huge), and instead of mustard, they serve an annato mayo on the side. And I don't know what's in it, but I wish I did because i would put it on everything. I always ask for extra sauce, and I go through all of it - it's delicious. Ray's is vey well-known for the burgers (and those are good too), but I highly recommend giving the Cuban a try.Ray's drink game is strong, too. Like I said, they have two different bars, which means they have twice as many taps available as most places. And they switch out the options regularly, so there's always something new to try. One thing I'm trying to get into is asking for samples of beers before I make my decision, and Ray's is a great place to start the habit, because there's so much to choose from. If you're not into beer, no worries - they also serve wine, and their cocktails are affordable and well made.Considering how popular Ray's is, it's not uncommon to have a wait, especially if you have a larger party. I've recently noticed that they've started seating guests on the weekends, which is a big culture change. And I'm not sure I like it - Ray's is a bar, and it's set up like a bar. There's no space for a hostess station, and without that, there's no visual cue that you shouldn't seat yourself - so you'll see a lot of confused customers wondering why they can't stay at the table they found for themselves. But it's no reason not to go - just look around as you walk in to see if there's a bartender-turned-hostess running around seating people before you search out a table on your own.
The Blue Cow is amazing!! The sun fries are delicious and Rays place never disappoints!
my food was pretty good but i got bit by a spider that was hiding under the table & my hand went numb

I can't say enough good things about this place. I first came here 3 years ago looking for a place with good beer and decent food while I'm in town. I have since been here every single time I have visited. The food is amazing (they smoke all of their meats), beer selection is awesome, and the service is great.

We have came here several times and have never been disappointed. The staff from bartenders to waiters were so helpful, friendly and informative. We let them know we were new in town and they told us about the area and gave us suggestions of places to check out. We love the food and atmosphere here each time we've visited.

Staff were very knowledgeable concerning food allergies but menu just didn't have many options for gluten free and dairy free. My vegetarian friend was very happy with her vegetable stir fry. We happen to visit on a day that a large group was having a birthday bar crawl and looked to be having a lot of fun. My grilled chicken salad was good. The portion was more than generous. Great location and memories from years past spent in this city and on the campus.

This was the worst steak I've ever had in my life!!!! I asked for well done not charcoal!!!! It literally tasted like charcoals and like it fell into the grill pit and they took it out dusted it off and served it...... I am totally disgusted and will never ever eat here again!!!!

This place is great! The downstairs seems small, but then there's a whole 2nd level with an additional bar and dining space. They have plenty of vegan/vegetarian options outside of your typical bar food option - black bean burger. They accommodated a group of 20-25 of us and made our experience one I'll definitely repeat. Our server, Chris, was super helpful and we'll request him on our next visit. He paid attention and really helped make this visit go smoothly.

I liked this bar. It was a fun place to hang out and have a couple drinks with friends without spending a fortune. The food was better than most bar food. Their menu is actually pretty extensive and they have daily specials. Everything was very reasonably priced. I had the atomic burger and Cajun fries.  Burgers are only $5-$6 and we ordered a basket of fries to share for 2 people and it was huge. 2 burgers, fries, and 4 beers came to $42. Not bad!

Very nice and a friendly atmosphere.  Stopped in for a quick bite. There was no wait time.  Food and wine selections were great . Service was excellent thanks to Brenton. Would definately recommend this place. ThxDR MD

Very good burger, would have enjoyed brewed iced tea. It looked like they have a nice beer selection but it was lunch time and I was working. Perhaps next time I'm in the area. Nice little place to grab a bite and a drink.

Decent place in downtown Kent. The I ordered a burger and fries, burger was good, but I'm always confused/dubious when they don't ask how you want it cooked (it appeared to be medium). The fries were okay, but were a but soggy. Overall, nice place, nothing amazing, nothing bad.
Very friendly staff. Huge selection of beers on tap. Magnificent eats. Bartender recommend the Cuban, really good recommendation. Dill pickle fries are a must-try!

Outstanding food, ambiance, beer list and service. The Mo Fo burger lived up to the hype.  The wait staff is super, helpful and eager to help.  The basket of fries were like going to the fair.  The Reuben was enormous but so full of flavor.  The burgers are flame grilled with the edge crust that makes the burger.  They cook their burgers to medium and it was delicious. Must stop in Kent.  Plus, extensive beer menu!  Always a plus.

I work in Ravenna, and decided to stop by Ray's for lunch with co-workers and I was very impressed with it. I had the BLT with jerk fries (fries with jerk seasoning) and it was all very tasty. The service was good, the servers were friendly, and the food came out in a timely manner. The place has a nice atmosphere, I will make it a point to check it out after hours sometime so I can sit at the bar and drink.
Best place in Kent hands down. They don't try to rip you off with a 8 oz pour of something that's only 9%

Updating my review...but keeping the rating the same.  Here's why.I like Ray's.  Really.  It's my favorite place to go with friends after a long week of graduate school work.  I love the atmosphere and the staff members who work there are great.  And yeah, they still serve Woodchuck.I do have two gripes.  First, they're kind of overpriced for what they serve.  I somehow managed to drop $50 here last time.  And they have a really bad habit of "forgetting" to give you the happy hour discounts.  From 4-9pm on most days they offer $1 off all drafts.  Well, when you get your bill later in the night, your discounts aren't reflected.  And your server will probably make a huge fuss if you ask that you bill be fixed.Gripe two: The food really sucks.  On my last review, I said it was passable.  I don't think so anymore.  Last time I went I ordered a grilled cheese and when they brought it out, the cheese wasn't even melted.  So, I sent it back.  When it was returned to me, it was exactly the same as when I sent it back, so they obviously didn't do anything to it.  Also, it tastes like they put salt all over the bread.  Really gross.  I've had similar issues with the quesadillas, the hummus (their hummus is foul), the veggie burger (also foul) and many other things.  The only "Safe" menu option is the sun stix (sweet potato fries) and even those are mediocre compared to other places.Go for the drinks and for the company, but do not go for the food.

Micheal Symon from network had this place on Best thing I ever ate. He was right the food is great and so is the service, I had a bacon cheese Philly and it was great.  I will be going back again. Kids can come here too.

You can't go wrong with their burgers and wings, some of the best in the county.  But this time I tried the corned beef sandwich on their special pumpernickel roll, if your into a lot of bread this is for you, if not, I recommend something else, the bread to meat ratio is way off.
Fantastic food, warm inviting environment. Great little neighborhood restaurant. Always happy to enjoy their food.

I went to Ray's on a Sunday afternoon. The first bartender who approached us had a bad attitude but the second one was delightful. I ordered a veggie burger and it was delicious as well as the sweet potato fries. However, NEVER order a margarita. They are disgusting and taste like tequila and salt water. Other than that, it was enjoyable.

Cannot call yourself a true Flash until you go to Rays. Amazing food and some awesome drinks for a great price. I enjoy the MOFO with a long island. Nothing better to get over a exam than a trip to Rays. I did order a Tequila Sunrise and the bartender was upset with my choice which soon became a LI, so you will also learn what a girl drink is lol.

Who doesn't like Rays? It is beloved by townies and students alike. Their food is great, their beer selection is great. LOVE that they have Strongbow on tap! They have an upstairs and a downstairs, large bars, a couple pool tables, and an open air area in the summer. If you aren't getting beer, the drinks are a bit pricey for the pour you get and it does get super crowded to the point sometimes you just can't go in. But those are the only downfalls. Overall, 4 stars.

Nice bar. Good food. Bartenders were really nice and knowledgeable. Jake was our bartender and really knew his beer and helped us get a good beer we liked. It's not hard to be nice and these guys know how to do it! Thanks for the good experience.

I was in town and read some good reviews so thought I'd try it out. Ordered a newer item the poutine. Their version has fries, pork, pork gravy, green onions and sprinkled with lettuce. I was pretty pumped until it showed up. I've had poutine at dozens of places, and I like all the ingredients they had listed but this dish showed up in a disgusting pile and just didn't work together. The wilted lettuce on top just made it worse. I tried to be open minded and tried a couple bites before giving up. When I went to pay my tab the bartender had left it on there, I had already told him i wasn't happy with the dish and returned 95% of it. He simply told me "yea it's not a traditional poutine" (DUH!) and never offered to take it off. I'm a generous tipper and not afraid to spend money on  good food, won't be back here though !

Stopped here when at Kent for a college function.  The place was pretty busy so I figured it had to be good.  At the encouragement of the waitress pumping the smoked meat, I decided on pulled pork.  Everything is ala carte so I also ordered cole slaw and rings.Pulled pork was medium warm.  Overly smoked and sauce was bland and salty.  Cole slaw was typical and fresh.  Rings were heavily breaded and greasy. This is the place for late night, drunk dining.  I wouldn't rexommend otherwise on what I ordered.Service was immediate and friendly.
NA

The food was tasty. The service was not so good. The waiter rushed us throughout our entire meal, even taking away food we hadn't finished. He made our experience a bit uncomfortable.The spicy garlic wings are good....try them!

Couldn't get enough of this place.  During my first visit to Kent, we went here twice in one day, once during the day and the other late at night.  Their Cuban sandwich is memorable.   I usually forget how foods taste after like 2 or 3 days, but its been about 60 days since I've had their food and I remember it.  Their menu describes their version of the Cuban as a sandwich with "ham, smoked pork, swiss cheese and dill pickles pressed together between grilled flatbread.  Served with a side of Annato mayonnaise." I was salivating as I was eating the sandwich--it was that good!  That Annato mayo was something else, I'd like to take a bottle of it home and just put it on everything I make.  When we went to Rays later that day for their night life, their kitchen was closed but they still had cold sandwiches. I had the turkey sandwich.  I'm not much of a cold sandwich person, but I was hungry, it tasted good and it did the trick.  They stuffed that sandwich with A LOT of juicy turkey!    Great experience!  I'll be back the next time I'm in Kent.
Nice place. Great atmosphere and the burgers where awesome. Definitely will come back again

I've been to Ray's about a half-dozen times  before as I live three hours away from my best friend in Kent. I usually stick to the burgers - I love them - but this time I decided I felt like the hot pastrami on grilled rye sandwich and some fries. The fries were great, as was my friend's Cuban sandwich, but unfortunately the pastrami on my sandwich was so caked in straight black pepper that it was inedible - black pepper was all I could taste, even on the meat that was away from the peppered edges. Couldn't taste the rye bread, the swiss cheese or the whole-grain mustard. I called the waitress over so I could just send the sandwich back and have it removed from my bill, and I'd just finish the fries. Wasn't very impressed when she told me (very kindly - no fault to her) that the sandwich couldn't be removed from the bill and my only options were to have a corned beef sandwich or a sandwich (didn't get the name) that apparently comes with pastrami and cole slaw; the cole slaw would apparently 'calm the pepper down'? Then there was a remark in the direction of telling me all about how pastrami was made - I make it myself at home (and yes I do use pepper) so that was a little condescending and not really necessary. I understand the stuff gets a pepper rub on the outside, and I put plenty on mine but yours is too much. I saw slices of meat with nearly a quarter-inch of pepper on the rim. So to wind it up, I would have been pleased if this had happened differently. There shouldn't be any quibble about taking a sandwich off a check if your customer finds it inedible after three bites! It's *very* bad business to make a customer pay for inedible food, and also bad business to not have a manager to the table to discuss what went wrong. There was some kind of a discount applied to the check by the server which was nice but it wasn't the whole amount of the sandwich. And on another note, my friend and I both were looking for beers and the beer list is so heavy with IPAs there were hardly any other types to choose from. Maybe shake it up a little bit and remember there's a large (very large) segment of the population that find IPAs bitter and weirdly grapefruity. So, two stars for the inedible food with no manager apology, too IPA-heavy beer list, and the policy of not immediately taking inedible food off a customer's check. All my other visits would have been a 4 or 5 star and I'm hoping next time I come back I can give one of those.

Great service, warm ambience, and excellent food! This is my go to stop when I go out to eat in Kent. They have award winning burgers and the wings are pretty fabulous too (just order them extra crispy!) They feature specialty drinks each month, and the bartenders have to pass an exam before serving so they know what they are doing. Try their long island (better than any other I've had) or futhermucker if you want something a little sweeter.

My first time there was last night, March 22, took 43 minutes to get our food, which came out lukewarm except for the onion rings and they were cold. My burger was so dry that I might as well been eating peanut butter off a spoon. Needless to say, won't be going back!
Great local bar with adequate food selection and a wonderful atmosphere in downtown Kent.

Found this place on Yelp and gave it a try - glad we did! The craft beer selection was very good and we tried the famous Ray's Reuben sandwich with a side of coleslaw. Both were delicious. All the other reviews were true - great place to drink, hang out with friends and eat if you feel like it. Classic college town pub atmosphere.
The best bar in Kent to go for a burger, and beer. A downtown Kent classic! Good atmosphere, and lots of selection!

Nothing fancy, but a great burgers-and-fries place if you're down for some casual fare. Prices are more than reasonable and portions are ample. Great craft beer selection, too. FYI, there is an upstairs, so don't be discouraged if the downstairs is full. Try this if you're in the neighborhood for a show at the Kent Stage, as it is right around the corner.

Yummy and fun! This is such a great, young restaurant/bar. There atmosphere is hip, quirky, and exciting. Their Long Island is the favorite drink for everyone. Their burgers are delicious as well. I have a lot of fun whenever I come here no matter what hour it is (dinner time or going out time). I recommend coming here with a group of friends to hang out and eat some appetizers. The conversations will flow and no one will want to leave!
Rays is my go to place any time my family or friends come into town. With a great bar/restaurant atmosphere, friendly waiters, and delicious food there really is no place like Rays!

Since I was visiting my baby sis in college (Kent), I came here for lunch with them, hearing that there's this MOFO burger that was pretty awesome to try. Even if I'm on this strict diet of mine, I decided to try it anyways since I came from out of town and supposedly it's amazing. Boy, was I right. It felt like I didn't have a burger in ages! Stacked with 2 meat patties and all the works, it was DE-licious. It's definitely a lot to consume for 1 person so I split it up with my sister. The bottom bun got soggy after having it stacked with lots of ingredients on top but I didn't care much about it anyways since I was starving. Along with our burgers, we also ordered their sweet potatoe fries which was good as well but we ordered way too much food for just 4 of us. We were stuffed! As far as the place goes, it's a casual. So nothing fancy at all. It is a bar at night but during the daytime, they serve breakfast and lunch. The bathrooms were a bit out-dated and kinda gross. But what can you expect from a bar that was probably filled with college students the night before?
The shrimp appetizer is the reason I come the 100 beers on tap is the reason I found out about it and the atmosphere is why I have a hard time leaving

Waiter is awesome; on top of orders and available. However, we paid to play the TouchTunes off our phone apps, and the bar refuses to turn the volume up because they say they prefer to play regular radio music instead... WHAT?!  Cannot even hear the radio music.

Great beer selection. However, do not use the condiments. One dude drank the vinegar (out of the bottle!) and we caught and reported him to our waitress. The manager didn't do anything and it was brought back despite our complaint.

So I really didn't remember eating here a lot when I was in college at Kent, but I knew I had to take my fiancé here when we were in town. I'm so glad I did!We started with the eggplant dip that was so good. It was flavorful without being overpowering. A great start to our meal.I had the stuff gourmet burger & oh my god was it good! The onions, cheese, mushrooms everything together was on point!!! Hunny got the bacon cheeseburger and was equally pleased! We decided to split the single order of jerk fries and I'm so glad we did!! Fresh cut fries with awesome seasoning, sign me up again!!

The area's best restaurant/bar for a reason! Great food at a great price! Really well made drinks, the bar tenders definitely know their stuff, and they are fast even on busy nights! Great music, great atmosphere! They even have life music occasionally and special events like wine and pairing, I mean even their pool tables have all of the balls, very rare for a bar! When I'm in town I always make sure to stop in!

I'm a Kent resident most of my life and I've been going to Ray's since the early 70s. Food and service has always been great and they've stayed true to what got them where they are at today!!! Highly recommend
Best burgers!! Love the bleu cow, sunstix and a Guinness on draft. Hits the spot every time!!!
They have a wide variety of beers, from darks to IPA. I love their sun sticks (sweet potato fries). Sometimes I go there for a snack giant basket of sweet potato fries and a cold beer.
Love Ray's Place! Always playing great music. Good for a night out or a just dinner/lunch. It's bar food - nothing crazy - but always good!

I feel like I would like this place a lot more if I could drink. The food is alright, just the typical bar food but it is always fairly busy and exciting which I like. It's definitely the place where the college kids come to drink and watch sports games but the people in it usually aren't obnoxious.

Met a friend here after the Kent State football game. We ordered a Reuben, Cuban sandwich and a BLT along with a basket of fries. Sandwiches were very good and very big. The fries were huge and just like you'd get at the fair. Do yourself a favor and try Ray's next time in downtown Kent.

Going strong for 77 years and now under its fourth owner, Charles Thomas, we've frequented Rays Place since Jack Lambert partied here. Yes, THE Jack Lambert of KSU and Pittsburgh Steelers fame. Side Note: He had all his teeth then.)Beers on tap so numerous they change eight each month as new beers. Known as one of the first bars in the US to televise football games.Great sandwiches with many burger choices. Opens at 11 through 2:30 am with a special "late night" menu after 11 pm. Noisy late at night with students. Pleasant until then with distincltly different lunch and dinner crowds.The phone booth doesn't work any more but that is the only change in all these years. Known by parents of all KSU grads with no bad references. Come and enjoy a burger and a brew at Rays.Edited to add: These men have also been known to eat and drink here: Rich Rollins, Thurman Munson, Steve Stone, Nick Sabin and Josh Cribbs.

I came here from Cleveland and was in kent for work so I yelped good places around me and this place came up. Based on the reviews fried mac&cheese, jerk fries, and a burger is the way to go. I got all of those which I got the Atomic Burger, sounds better than it was. By no means was the FOOD BAD, it just wasn't anything special. First with the mac&cheese bites they were good. If you have ever gotten mac&cheese bites at Sheetz, these are the same exact ones and probably more expensive. I would not say this is a must have item. The atomic burger wasn't anything special. The patty seemed like it might have been out of a box. The party was bland. The toppings was nothing special just some pepper jack cheese and some Jalapeños out of a jar. I would try something else than a burger if I came back here. The jerk fries were good. The portion is large enough for two people to eat them. If you are into the jerk dust I would recommend them. They were also fresh cut so that is a plus. The bar overall has a very cool vibe I would go there to drink at night. Their cash register is old school and give a cool touch. Lots of beer options too!
It's Rays! What's not to like? Food isn't bad, some items are much better than others - I like their rubens and fries. Decent beer selection.

I had been to Ray's several times in the past, but based on Michael Simon's recommendation, I tried the MoFo. I was not disappointed. Fresh beef, cooked to perfection, fresh toppings. A pretty good crowd on a Friday at 10ish did not prevent our server from doing a nice job with a pleasant attitude.The area is pretty cool, with several eateries and bars. Especially in the summer us older folks can relive the feel of a college town without having to wade through drunken frat boys.I would encourage those looking for hummus and vegetarian to seek other options. This place is good for tavern food.
Very busy for the weekday lunch. The food is the draw. The salads are huge. It's probably the best place for lunch around. For a college town you can't beat it.
Draft list had a nice variety. The pig rub wings were amazing. But the staff, ehhh. Took us like 30 minutes to get a check and we had two servers...that were kinda assholes not gonna lie
Great burgers and the best French Onion soup in town!!

Ray's  = Dying BreedThis place have everything you'd ever need in a college bar and it doesn't try to be anything it's not. Don't forget to come here on your birthday to spin the wheel for your free birthday shot :)
Large portions and very affordable. Not a fan of their horseradish thousand island dressing on the Reuben.

I had been meaning to go for a while, as it is quite a legend in the Kent area. While I passed on the "MOFO" burger, I opted instead for a burger of lesser size, and a side of fries to share. My freind also had a smaller burger and it was plenty of food. The burgers were good, not great, but very well cooked and pretty moist. The fries were good as well. Service was excellent, and the decor is vintage sports bar..........which is what this place has always been!!I'll definately be back!

Ray's is an institution, a delicious, delicious institution. Great beer list, great food list. The only thing I see as a consistent issue is that we're frequently there with kids (during normal kid-friendly hours...tyvm...they have a kids' menu, okay?) and the servers don't seem to understand the importance of GTFO when we're done eating. Bring us the check, take our credit card, and bring it right back. I cannot stress how important this is to us, to the kiddos, and most importantly, to the other patrons.
My wife and I stopped by tonight and the food was great and in large portions definitely get your money's worth!
Great service Shelby and Paulina are phenomenal.The food was great but the service was the best I can remember in any restaurant

If you love craft beer and great food this is a "must stop" place when in Kent.  I go there for their awesome Meatloaf dinner and sandwich while getting my growler filled with the Columbus Bodhi when they have it.  Their beer selection is always one of the best around and food is all cooked on site.  I'm not sure which we like better, the food or the beer:)  The staff is very friendly and prompt too.  Ray's has been around a long time, they know great food and offer great craft beers!!  And don't forget to check out the upstairs bar too, same great food and different beer lists sometimes.One year later:Back many times and sad to say but food is going downhill I'm afraid.  Beers are great but last three times here very disappointed with our meals.  Service is still great just not tasty like it use to be.  Fries hard or very crunchy etc?  So great place for drinking but that is it lately.
Car Bombs.Good Beer.Good Liquor (and by good I mean Bombay Sapphire).

This place sucks! Really has gone downhill. Where to start, there was lipstick and greasy fingerprints all over my beer glass, the menus are always dirty and extremely sticky, the fries are very often still raw! Just barely warm and still hard to touch, not edible!! The staff are rude and unattentive, and a proper detailed readable itemized receipt would be nice, it's 2018!

Love it. Been here on several occasions - difficult to find a seat if you come at prime dinner hours but any good bar/restaurant is. Reasonably priced, always very friendly service. Mostly a beer bar - not really a cocktail type of place (not that they can't make the standards). The only thing I would improve would be the restrooms - extremely dated, dirty and small. Go ahead and take out a booth to make the necessary renovations- your business/customers are worth it.

Great burgers...handsdown!  As a Kent Alumni---of course this place is an institution for me.  A friendly relaxed atmosphere, with a large on tap offering, great burgers and fries.   The Mofo burger is my fav----though I can never finish it---the hubby gladly eats his and what I can't eat of mine.  We had the peanut butter cheesecake last night and it was delightful.

Went there with a couple of my buddies, one of them got charged for $25, when in reality he only bought two Long Islands worth $8.50.
